definition: (coll.) to fire sb/to sack sb
to sauté/to stir-fry/to speculate/to hype/to fire (sb)
cuttlefish
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]
surname Yu

sentences.english: I heard that the anchorman of the DBD TV network's evening news got fired.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說DBD電視網的晚間新聞主播被炒魷魚。

sentences.english: B：They will be fired some day.
sentences.chinese: 他們總有一天會被炒魷魚。

sentences.english: Hi, Maggy, Did you hear about David?
sentences.chinese: 我聽說戴維被炒魷魚了。

sentences.english: After working in the office for ten years， Alice was fired for no apparent reason.
sentences.chinese: 愛麗斯工作了十年之後，無緣無故被炒魷魚。

sentences.english: And which of you goes home and rationalizes being fired as character building?
sentences.chinese: 誰會回家反省找出被炒魷魚的原因以重塑性格？

sentences.english: NO06,1. The scuttlebutt in the office is that Tom is going to be fired.
sentences.chinese: 辦公室裏有謠言說湯姆要被炒魷魚了。

sentences.english: I heard that BCB's evening news anchor was canned.
sentences.chinese: 電視網的晚間新聞主播被炒魷魚。

sentences.english: You did what you were told to do or you were fired.
sentences.chinese: 叫你做什麼你就得去做，不然就被炒魷魚。

sentences.english: That bozo flirt with the boss'daughter and nearly get fired.
sentences.chinese: 那個笨蛋跟老闆的女兒調情，差一點被炒魷魚。

sentences.english: Candidate told the interviewer he was fired for beating up his last boss.
sentences.chinese: 應聘者奉告面試官上次炒魷魚的端由是揍了那位僱主。

sentences.english: Which of you goes home and rationalizes being fired as character building?
sentences.chinese: 誰會回家反省找出被炒魷魚的原因以重塑性格？

definition: to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
irrelevant/beside the point
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
reckless/extremely daring
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: to walk right into the trap
to get straight to the point (idiom)
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
to behead
to exaggerate
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
lit. small abacus/fig. selfish calculations/bean-counting
attributive (modifier)
